item.title: 重启外汇政策后，IMF 董事会将于周三讨论阿根廷问题
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，国际货币基金组织执行董事会将于周三在华盛顿举行的一次非正式会议上讨论阿根廷的 200 亿美元计划。【原文：The International Monetary Fund’s executive board will discuss Argentina’s $20 billion program on Wednesday during an informal session in Washington, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 加拿大油砂抵御价格下跌，计划 2026 年实现增长
item.description: 以 Cenovus Energy Inc. 为首的加拿大油砂生产商计划明年扩大生产，尽管即将出现的供应过剩有可能加深原油价格的低迷。【原文：Canadian oil sands producers lead by Cenovus Energy Inc. plan to expand production next year despite an impending supply glut that threatens to deepen the slump in crude prices.】

item.title: 贝莱德将为员工的 "特朗普账户 "捐款提供配捐
item.description: 贝莱德公司（BlackRock Inc.【原文：BlackRock Inc. will match government contributions to “Trump accounts” for its employees, making it one of the first major US companies to lay out plans for supporting the early-childhood savings program.】

item.title: Bending Spoons 为 AOL 收购融资交易提供优惠条件
item.description: 意大利科技初创企业 Bending Spoons 大幅改善了向投资者提供的高达 13.5 亿美元收购融资方案的条件。【原文：Italian tech startup Bending Spoons has significantly improved the terms it is offering to investors on an acquisition financing package of as much as $1.35 billion.】

item.title: Medline在本年度最大规模首次公开募股后表示将高开6.9
item.description: Medline 公司的股票开盘价比首次公开发行价高出 6.9%，这家医疗供应商在今年最大的一次上市中筹集了 62.6 亿美元。【原文：Medline Inc. shares are indicated to open 6.9% above their initial public offering price, after the medical supplier raised $6.26 billion in the year’s biggest listing.】

item.title: 汽车制造商和气候组织联合批评欧盟电动汽车计划
item.description: 欧盟建议通过放宽严格的排放规定来帮助欧洲濒临破产的汽车行业，目的是帮助陷入困境的汽车制造商。然而，汽车行业和气候运动人士都没有为此感到高兴。【原文：The European Union’s proposal to help Europe’s ailing auto industry by softening strict emissions rules was intended to help struggling carmakers. Yet neither the industry nor climate campaigners are celebrating.】

item.title: 伊根-琼斯举报人建立了自己的私人信用评级机构
item.description: Michael Brawer 在 Egan-Jones Ratings Co. 担任首席风险官长达四年多时间，见证了该公司成长为私人信贷市场的一支生力军。【原文：Michael Brawer spent more than four years as chief risk officer at Egan-Jones Ratings Co., seeing the firm grow into a force in the private credit market.】

item.title: 凯雷将发起要约收购日本公司 Hogy Medical
item.description: 凯雷投资集团（Carlyle Group Inc.【原文：Carlyle Group Inc. has launched a takeover offer for Hogy Medical Co. in the latest private equity-led deal of a Japanese company.】

item.title: 欧洲导弹制造商吹捧无人机战争的低成本解决方案
item.description: 欧洲防务初创企业弗兰肯堡科技公司（Frankenburg Technologies）称，其微型防空导弹已成功通过测试，可对付俄罗斯向乌克兰发射的高速攻击无人机。【原文：European defense startup Frankenburg Technologies says its tiny air-defense missiles have been successfully tested against high-speed attack drones like those Russia launches at Ukraine, as militaries hunt for cost-effective ways to counter cheap threats.】

item.title: 甲骨文称蓝猫头鹰不在密歇根州交易中，谈判正在进行中
item.description: 甲骨文公司（Oracle Corp. ）表示，关于密歇根州数据中心项目股权交易的最终谈判 "如期进行"，其中不包括蓝猫资本（Blue Owl Capital），该公司最近几个月曾帮助甲骨文和 Meta Platforms Inc. 等公司的大型数据中心项目融资。【原文：Oracle Corp. said final negotiations on an equity deal for a data center project in Michigan are “on schedule” and doesn’t include Blue Owl Capital, a firm that has helped finance massive data center projects for firms including Oracle and Meta Platforms Inc. in recent months.】

item.title: 帕梅林称瑞士企业可从美国关税中获益数百万美元
item.description: 瑞士经济部长表示，瑞士公司可能有权要求美国退还 "数亿法郎 "的关税，因为两国之间的贸易协议将追溯适用。【原文：Swiss companies are potentially entitled to claim “several hundred million francs” in tariff refunds from the US because the trade deal between the nations will be applied retroactively, Switzerland’s economy minister said.】

item.title: 加拿大第三季度人口下降 0.2%，为大流行病以来首次下降
item.description: 加拿大人口在第三季度下降了 0.2%，为 4 160 万人，这是在科维德-19 时代之外有记录以来唯一的季度下降，也是移民大流行后爆炸性增长的一个戏剧性转变。【原文：Canada’s population fell by 0.2% in the third quarter to stand at 41.6 million, marking the only quarterly decline on record outside the Covid-19 era and a dramatic shift from explosive post-pandemic immigration growth.】

item.title: 米莱重启阿根廷外汇政策，抑制比索剧烈波动
item.description: 每天早上，阿根廷中央银行外汇交易台的交易员们都会带着一项简单的任务开始工作：不让比索上下波动过大。【原文：Every morning at the Argentine central bank, traders on its foreign exchange desk start with a simple mission: Keep the peso from moving too far up or down.】

item.title: 美国游戏机销量暴跌，创二十年来最差十一月销量
item.description: 由于关税和不断上涨的零部件成本将价格推向历史新高，上个月美国在视频游戏机方面的支出下降了 27%，创下了二十年来最糟糕的十一月。【原文：US spending on video game consoles fell 27% last month, marking the worst November in two decades as tariffs and rising component costs pushed prices to record highs.】

item.title: 科斯拉主导的交易推动金融科技公司估值达到 12 亿美元
item.description: 金融科技初创公司Imprint Payments Inc.帮助布鲁克斯兄弟（Brooks Brothers）等零售商提供联名信用卡，该公司在Khosla Ventures领投的新一轮融资中估值达到12亿美元。【原文：Fintech startup Imprint Payments Inc., which helps retailers like Brooks Brothers offer co-branded credit cards, has reached a valuation of $1.2 billion in a new funding round led by Khosla Ventures.】

item.title: 美联储沃勒发表鸽派言论后，国债收窄跌幅
item.description: 在美联储理事克里斯托弗-沃勒（Christopher Waller）重申对美国利率持鸽派观点后，国债跌幅收窄。【原文：Treasuries pared declines after Federal Reserve Governor Christopher Waller, who’s under consideration to become chair of the central bank, reiterated his dovish views on US interest rates.】

item.title: 美联储主席沃勒尔希望降低利率，但表示不急于降息
item.description: 美联储理事克里斯托弗-沃勒（Christopher Waller）支持进一步降息，以使央行的设定恢复中性，同时表示决策者不必急于这么做。【原文：Federal Reserve Governor Christopher Waller backed further interest-rate cuts to get the central bank’s setting back to neutral, while saying policymakers need not rush to do so.】

item.title: 印度允许外资 100%控股保险业以促进该行业发展
item.description: 印度批准外商 100%投资其保险业，这是一项具有里程碑意义的改革，旨在吸引更多全球资本进入世界上增长最快的市场之一。【原文：India approved 100% foreign investment in its insurance industry, a landmark reform aimed at drawing more global capital into one of the world’s fastest-growing markets.】

item.title: 非洲将在欧洲债券之外寻找其他途径，以弥补 2026 年 830 亿美元的资金缺口
item.description: 根据 BMI 的数据，明年非洲各国政府的融资成本预计将达到近 830 亿美元，为 2021 年以来的最高水平，非洲各国政府将转而采用非常规的方式来解决融资问题。【原文：African governments will turn to unconventional ways to meet financing costs expected to reach almost $83 billion next year, the highest level since 2021, according to BMI.】

item.title: 韩国养老基金与韩国央行互换后开始对冲外汇风险
item.description: 据一位熟悉内情的人士透露，韩国国营养老基金已经启动了最近与韩国银行签署的外汇掉期协议。【原文：South Korea’s state-run pension fund has activated a foreign-exchange swap agreement it recently signed with the Bank of Korea, according to a person familiar with the matter.】

item.title: Manus 称其销售额在发布数月后达到 1.25 亿美元的运行率
item.description: 中国人工智能先驱 Manus 在发布旨在帮助用户执行任务的人工智能代理八个月后表示，其年收入已超过 1.25 亿美元。【原文：Chinese AI pioneer Manus said its annual run rate for revenue is over $125 million, eight months after it released artificial intelligence agents designed to help execute tasks for users.】

item.title: 可可反弹扩大，盈余预期缩小
item.description: 可可在纽约连续第二天上涨，原因是交易商权衡了对本季过剩前景的看法，以及与指数相关的买盘支撑市场的前景。【原文：Cocoa rose for a second day in New York, as traders weighed a reduced outlook for this season’s surplus and the prospect of index-related buying supporting the market.】

item.title: 贝尔告诉账户规模较小的客户增加基金或退出
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，瑞士宝盛集团正在告诉一些在该银行存款余额较少的客户，增加他们在财富管理公司的投资金额，否则就去其他银行。【原文：Julius Baer Group Ltd. is telling some clients with lower balances at the bank to increase the amount of funds they invest with the wealth manager or go elsewhere, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 司法部称，三色公司创始人因涉嫌欺诈被起诉
item.description: Tricolor Holdings 创始人 Daniel Chu 被联邦检察官指控合谋欺诈公司贷款人和投资者。【原文：Tricolor Holdings founder Daniel Chu was charged by federal prosecutors with conspiring to defraud lenders and investors of the company.】

item.title: 核电初创企业 Radiant 为小型反应堆融资 3 亿美元
item.description: Radiant Industries Inc. 是一家总部位于加利福尼亚州的初创公司，该公司筹集了 3 亿多美元，用于将其小型反应堆设计商业化，因为电力需求的激增提高了人们对核能的兴趣。【原文：Radiant Industries Inc., a California-based startup, raised more than $300 million to commercialize its small reactor design as surging demand for electricity drives up interest in nuclear energy.】

item.title: 人工智能芯片初创公司神话公司融资 1.25 亿美元，欲与英伟达一较高下
item.description: 芯片初创公司 Mythic Inc. 在新一轮融资中筹集了 1.25 亿美元，这笔资金将有助于支持该公司在利润丰厚的人工智能处理器市场上挑战英伟达公司（Nvidia Corp.【原文：Chip startup Mythic Inc. has raised $125 million in a new funding round, money that will help support its attempt to challenge Nvidia Corp. in the lucrative market for artificial intelligence processors.】

item.title: 甲骨文成为科技公司 5000 亿美元人工智能租金狂潮的中心
item.description: 包括甲骨文公司（Oracle Corp）、微软公司（Microsoft Corp）和Meta Platforms公司（Meta Platforms Inc）在内的云计算公司已承诺，未来几年在数据中心租赁上的总投入将达到5000亿美元，这一天文数字凸显了该行业在人工智能上的赌注。【原文：Cloud-computing companies including Oracle Corp., Microsoft Corp. and Meta Platforms Inc. have committed to spend a combined $500 billion on data center leases in the coming years, an astronomical sum that underscores the bet the industry is making on artificial intelligence.】

item.title: 英国波音供应商 Doncasters 据称将为美国上市挑选银行
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，拥有近 250 年历史、为波音公司供货的英国金属工程集团 Doncasters Group 已选定了在美国首次公开募股的银行，该公司的估值可能超过 40 亿美元。【原文：Doncasters Group, an almost 250-year-old UK metal engineering group that supplies Boeing Co., has selected banks for a US initial public offering that could value the firm at more than $4 billion, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 委内瑞拉石油产量长期低迷，特朗普封锁令市场受挫
item.description: 委内瑞拉油轮封锁的市场影响和地缘政治意义截然不同【原文：The market impact and geopolitical significance of the Venezuela tanker blockade are quite different】

item.title: 前谷歌首席执行官的数据中心公司与得克萨斯州土地所有者合作
item.description: 一家由前谷歌首席执行官埃里克-施密特（Eric Schmidt）共同创办的数据中心公司与得克萨斯州的一家大型土地所有者合作开发大型数据中心。【原文：A data center firm co-founded by ex-Google chief Eric Schmidt has partnered with a major Texas landowner to develop large-scale data hubs.】
